intro: Crocosmia pearsei, commonly known as the orange lily, is a striking herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It features tall, sword-shaped leaves and produces vibrant orange-red flowers in late summer. The plant belongs to the iris family (Iridaceae) and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to naturalize and spread through rhizomes.
